result.execSummary:
The defendant Doreen F Stadler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Abuse Patients-No Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.295(3)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-No Contact with the victim or Berlin Pines CBRP.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Doreen F Stadler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:10 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - will proceed with plea & sentencing with a brief argument.  ADA recites agreement - upon plea to the charge will request probation with a free to argue.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-$100 fine plus court costs
-No Contact with the victim or Berlin Pines CBRF (forms)
-25 hours of community service
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:22 a.m.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:17 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - has been retained to represent the defendant.  Court denies the request for court appointed counsel.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 12, 2016 at 10:00 a.m . 

Court adjourned at 9:18 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 15, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:57 a.m.
